source.name: reading question built-in objects
source.instructions:
## Reading Question

Fill in the blanks below.
source.text:
A <<<class>>> is the blueprint used to create object.
An <<<object>>> a version of a class used by programmers.
An object is said to be an <<<instance>>> of a class.
<<<Instantiation>>> is when an object is created from a class.
source.guidance:
A class is the blueprint used to create object.
An object a version of a class used by programmers.
An object is said to be an instance of a class.
Instantiation is when an object is created from a class.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT define class, object, instance, and instantiation

source.name: reading question user-define objects
source.guidance:
When instantiating an object, you start by giving the object a type. In this case, the type is `Pitcher`. Give the object a name followed by the assignment operator. Use the `new` keyword and the class name to create a new object of type `Pitcher`.

```java
Pitcher pedro = new Pitcher();
```

To access a class attribute, use dot notation. That means using the object's name (`pedro`) followed by a `.`, and the use the name of the attribute. Assign the value `2.93` to the attribute like you would a variable.

```java
pedro.era = 2.93;
```
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify how to instantiate an object and modify an attribute
